884744932:
[

Lecturer in Medical Science

Company Name Charles Sturt University Company Location Wagga Wagga, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 8 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Attractive Remuneration
  • Flexible Working Conditions
  • Work/life balance in a great location


The Role


  • Continuing, Full Time
  • Level B - $92,117 to $109,391 p.a. (plus 17% superannuation)
  • Wagga Wagga


Utilising blended models of subject delivery at undergraduate and postgraduate levels you will undertake an academic teaching load in an area of expertise within the School’s Medical Science teaching program including Professional Placement and one or more of the following: Clinical Biochemistry, Histology, Haematology & Blood Transfusion.


A key aspect to this role includes establishing and progressing an active profile in the Scholarship of Teaching and Learning as aligned to the strategic direction of the School of Biomedical Sciences Participation in the administration and ongoing curriculum development of courses offered by the School of Biomedical Sciences will also be expected.


To be successful you will have:


  • A doctoral or masters qualification appropriate to Medical Science or equivalent accreditation and standing
  • A record of research/creative works or professional activity relevant to the discipline
  • Sound knowledge and understanding of Medical Science or a relevant sub-discipline gained through industry experience and/or scholarly activities or similar
  • Evidence of the delivery of high-quality student-centred learning and teaching


About Us


Charles Sturt University is a young and growing university committed to developing far-sighted people who help their communities grow and flourish. We make a significant contribution to the prosperity and vibrancy of our rural and regional communities, with a reach and impact across Australia and internationally. We work together with industry, communities and students to create new thinking, inspire each other and make a positive and progressive contribution to the world.


The Faculty of Science delivers flexible, innovative teaching programs which provide graduates with the skills and knowledge to build a career, advance their profession and contribute to their community. We currently have more than 9000 students and over 500 staff dedicated to advancing scientific knowledge.


We are a leader in strategic and applied research in a wide array of sciences. We enhance and extend knowledge, train and educate future researchers and provide scientific solutions to current challenges. We achieve this through ethical practice, professional collaborations, industry involvement and a commitment to continual improvement.


We also provide a range of health and other services to our regional communities through our enterprise activities.


The School of Biomedical Sciences is located across CSU’s Wagga Wagga, Bathurst, Dubbo, Orange and Port Macquarie campuses and is committed to enhancing its reputation as a high performing multidisciplinary unit by having academics focused on providing quality education and being actively involved in a variety of medical, biotechnology and research-based programs that complement these courses.


CSU offers a great work-life balance, professional development opportunities and generous financial benefits.


Charles Sturt University is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Applications are encouraged from Indigenous Australians; people with a disability; women (particularly for senior and non-traditional roles); people who identify as LGBTIQ; and those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.


This position is open to Australian Citizens and Permanent Residents, or applicants who hold a current valid work visa commensurate with this position.


Application Requirements


Applicants are expected to apply online and address the selection criteria in the position description. If you experience difficulties applying online or for further information on completing the application process please visit our how to apply page or contact us.


Further Information


Additional information is available in the position description or by contacting:


Professor Rod Hill | Head, School of Biomedical Sciences | Email: bmshos@csu.edu.au | Phone:02 6933 2018


Closing Date: 11 pm, 2 October 2018

884759553:
[

Executive Director

Company Name Derwent Executive Company Location Sydney CBD, Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 33 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


The Independent Planning Commission is an independent planning body established on 1st March 2018. It operates independently of other Government agencies including the Department of Planning & Environment.


The key functions of the Commission include:

  • The key functions of the Commission include:determination of applications for major development as a consent authority, or under delegation from the Minister.
  • Providing independent expert advice on planning and development related matters.


The Commission plays an important role in strengthening transparency and independence in the decision-making processes for major development and land use planning in NSW. It provides an additional level of scrutiny in the provision of independent expert advice or determination of major development applications.


The Commission is served by the Commission Secretariat. The Secretariat is part of the support the Department of Planning & Environment supplies o the Commission under a Memorandum of Understanding between the two agencies. It comprises a small multidisciplinary team which works closely with the Chair of the Commission, Commission members, various stakeholders and the public.


Primary purpose of the role


Under the general direction of the Commission Chair, the Executive Director heads the Secretariat to the Commission, ensuring provision of the support needed for the Commission to deliver on its statutory responsibilities with a high level of professionalism and in a timely manner.


Please read the role description prior to preparing your application.


To be successful in this role you will be an experienced senior leader with the ability to provide expert high quality support to a high profile independent agency, making decisions that are often contentious.


Essential requirements


Degree qualification in a relevant discipline and/or equivalent relevant experience at a senior management level along with the ability and proven experience in producing high quality reports to tight deadlines.


Our commitment to diversity


We value diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We welcome and encourage applications from people of all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups and those with disability.


Role status


This constitutes ongoing employment under section 34 of the Government Sector Employment Act 2013, and the role is based in Sydney.


Eligibility


To be eligible to apply for ongoing employment within the NSW Department of Planning & Environment, candidates must be an Australian citizen or have the status of permanent residence in Australia.


How to apply


Please submit your resume along with a cover letter demonstrating how you meet the focus capabilities and other essential requirements of the role. Refer to the role description for details about the key accountabilities, capabilities and the associated behavioural indicators. The role description also lists the essential role requirements.


Should you require additional information prior to making an application please call Andrew McEncroe on (02) 9091 3230 or email amcencroe@derwentexecutive.com.au - reference #24180


Applications close 11.59 pm Wednesday 17th October



Desired Skills and Experience

Executive

Your primary responsibility is ensuring appropriate training activities are planned, designed, developed, delivered and evaluated with appropriate handover to Business as Usual (BAU) training teams.

  • Strong experience in identifying training needs, design, development, facilitation and evaluation

Your Opportunity

  • Delivering a professional and caring customer focused service

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 5 views

Job description

What You’ll Be Doing...

Verizon Connect is guiding a connected world on the go by automating, optimizing and revolutionizing the way people, vehicles and things move through the world. Our full suite of industry-defining solutions and services put innovation, automation and connected data to work for customers and help them be safer, more efficient and more productive. With more than 3,500 dedicated employees in 15 countries, we deliver leading mobile technology platforms and solutions.

As a SaaS leader, we know our talent is the most important component to our success. We hire top talent and empower them to do their best work. As a division of Verizon, we combine the fun and excitement of a start-up environment with the resources, operational excellence, and brand recognition of an established tech giant.

This position's primary function is to liaise with the training team to customize templates and manipulate data for the successful deployment of a customer’s account.

Responsibilities
  • Support the implementation team with onboarding new accounts by utilising primarily Microsoft Word to configure templates and Microsoft Excel to import/export data.
  • Own all aspects of uploading data and working with customers to make sure the data is configured correctly.
  • Utilize tools to analyze, query and manipulate data according to defined business rules and procedures.
  • Conduct complicated setup, configuration, data mining, troubleshooting and data scrubbing.
  • Make technology easily understandable for end users and showcase value to their business.
  • Document, track, and provide regular status updates on data upload via SalesForce.
  • Provide consistent and concise communication with the training team and the customer.
  • Assist with sales engineering on key accounts and work with sales team to understand client requirements.
  • Assist management in developing and refining implementation processes and documentation.
  • Analytical business thought process with the ability to present a plan and build confidence and trust with clients.
  • Ability to prioritize multiple assignments concurrently with minimal direction in a dynamic work environment.
  • Willingness to work flexible and/or extended hours to complete project tasks or serve clients in other time zones.
  • Excellent oral and written communication, organization and presentation skills with acustomer centric approach.
  • Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to present solutions and quickly resolve issues.
  • Ability to spend all day working at a desk using a PC and telephone.

What We’re Looking For...

You'll need to have:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, MIS is highly preferred.
  • 1-3 year’s experience in manipulating data via spreadsheets or other data tools.
  • Excel Macro/VBA coding abilities.
  • Highly proficient in Microsoft Office products especially Excel and Word.
  • Technical background with proven knowledge of software configuration within SaaS applications.
  • Knowledge of accounting software including Quickbooks, MYOB and Xero is highly preferred.
Keyword: VZConnect

When you join Verizon...

You’ll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America’s fastest and most reliable network, we’re leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. [

Food Experience Manager

Company Name Civic Disability Services Limited Company Location Nowra, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Food Experience Manager / Hospitality Manager

\xa0

Food, glorious food!

Flexible location (some travel may be required)

Happy to talk flexible hours

\xa0

About Us

\xa0

Civic is a not for profit disability services provider who has been supporting people to realise their potential for 60 years. We provide a range of supports and services and also do some cool stuff in the social enterprises space.

\xa0

About you

\xa0

Food is life. You live and breathe food and everything that sits around the act of eating. Because it’s not just nutrition. Or food safety compliance. It’s an experience. It’s health. It’s wellbeing. It’s connection to others.

\xa0

You’re a qualified chef with the ability to run a commercial kitchen. But you want something more. Build our food services business. Make it sustainable. Create the right support structures and operating model. Look for opportunities to grow our business. Create something for the people with disabilities we support – both clients of our accommodation services and the supported employees we work with in our social enterprises – to support others to realise their potential.

\xa0

Ideally you’ll have an understanding of the community services sector (disability services or aged care would be a big plus) and the needs relating to food and nutrition that people with a disability may experience.

\xa0

About the role

\xa0

Our social enterprises in the caf\xe9 space are growing. We now have cafes in Nowra and Caringbah, and a coffee cart at Merrylands. We offer catering, and there is incredible opportunity to look at the way we experience food in our accommodation services to promote overall wellbeing. This role is about changing the way Civic, and the people we support, experience food.

\xa0

This role is a little Head Chef, a little business development, a little food safety, a little policy and procedure, some planning, and a whole lot of love for food.

\xa0

Let’s set you up for success

\xa0

We want you to succeed! If we’ve piqued your interest, visit our website at civic.org.au and apply today. On our website you’ll find a copy of the Position Description with more info on the role and what we think you’ll need to succeed.

\xa0

Then send a resume and a cover letter to introduce yourself! Keep it on point. Limit it to 4 pages all up (resume and cover letter).

\xa0

Curious to learn more?

\xa0

Call Kate Smith, General Manager – Business Development, on 0478 8 33 150 for a confidential chat, to talk flexible options, or to learn more.

Be an early applicant

Job description

About The Company

genU is short for Generation You. Because whatever generation you belong to, whether you’re young, old, or somewhere in between, what unites us is the belief that neither disability nor ageing are disadvantages to be endured but challenges to be met boldly, achievements to be had and adventures in the making.

GenU has been 60 years in the making. Bringing together the best of two trusted and respected organisations, Karingal and St Laurence, genU builds on this experience, adding a new ambition: to become the leader in what we do.

About The Role

The Team Leader will provide inspirational leadership and operational management to our shared supported accommodation homes and ensure an empowering and enabling environment for people with disabilities, whilst still maximising opportunities for the attainment of personal goals and lifestyles that are valued by the wider community.

Reporting to the Operations Manager, the duties of the Team Leader will include:
  • Proactively promote a home like environment that enhances the well-being of people with disabilities and is welcoming of families, friends and other visitors.
  • Undertake program planning and monitoring functions including reviews and written reports as required
  • Develop a productive working relationship to effectively manage up and manage house staff
  • Assist to recruit, induct, develop and support staff working within the facility to ensure that they can meet expectations and support residents
  • Maintain accurate financial records including household expenditure and individual resident personal expenditure


About You
  • Significant experience delivering services in the disability industry
  • Minimum Cert IV in Disability Studies or equivalent
  • Current First Aid- Certificate II Level and CPR certificate
  • Demonstrated ability to provide person centred active supports for residents
  • Working with Children Check
  • Experience leading and managing a team of staff
  • Good computer skills including; in house data base systems, MS office and excel
  • Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills

In applying for this role, you will be subject to a Disability Worker Exclusion Scheme check. This is a check of an individual's name against a database held by the Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) that records individuals who pose a proven risk to the health, safety or welfare of people with a disability living in group homes. If your name is on or is placed on the list, you will be ineligible to work as a residential disability support worker with Karingal St Laurence.

For further details please contact Joel Scott - 0428 751 865

Please find below the position description outlining full details of this role:

 genU Team Leader PD Sept 18.pdf

Pool Lifeguard

Company Name Kingston Municipal Non-Profit Housing Corporation (Town Homes Kingston) Company Location Melbourne, AU

Job description

Short Description

City of Kingston's Leisure Centres, Waves and Don Tatnell are currently recruiting for qualified Lifeguards to join our Operations team. You will utilise your experience in pool life guarding techniques and customer service to provide a safe and enjoyable environment for the community.
Employer
Kingston City Council - Kingston Leisure Centres
Work Type
Casual
Salary
$35 ph
Salary Currency
Australian Dollar
Location
Melbourne, VIC, Australia

Detailed Description

City of Kingston's Leisure Centres, Waves and Don Tatnell are currently recruiting for qualified Lifeguards to join our Operations team.

You will utilise your experience in pool life-guarding techniques and customer service to provide a safe and enjoyable environment for the community.

Casual ($34.04 per/hr plus superannuation)

You must hold a current Pool Lifeguard award, a Level 2 First Aid certificate, defibrillator qualification and a Working with Children check. You will also be required to undertake a Police check. In addition to these accreditations, you will have demonstrated high standards of initiative, safety awareness and customer service.

Our lifeguards are an integral part of our team and are required to be focused and capable of responding quickly to emergency situations. We are recipients of the Life Saving Victoria Platinum Pool Award and we promote safety and enjoyment including the Watch Around the Water program.

Lifeguards are required to educate the community, enforce our Watch Around the Water policy and provide exceptional customer service at all times. As part of our customer focused team, your ability to establish friendly and professional relationships with our members and provide accurate information on all services available at the Centre will be essential to your success.

The successful candidate will pride themselves on building effective working relationships, and will be able to demonstrate strong safety standards, strong communication and customer service skills. The successful candidate will be required to complete pre-employment checks consisting of a Police Check and Working with Children Check.

You must have a flexible attitude and be available to work various hours including weekends, mornings and evenings.

If this sounds like you, we want you part of our team!

Selection Criteria

Essential
  • Working with children check
  • Drivers Licence
  • Defibrillator Award
Closing Date
4 Oct 2018

File Attachments

Other Details

Key to your success will be:
  • Previous experience as a Lifeguard highly regarded
  • Being aware of current life guarding and first aid techniques, ensuring that patrons receive professional supervision and first aid attention at all times.
  • The position requires the incumbent to be able to perform life guarding and first aid to patrons, ensuring a duty of care is demonstrated.
  • The ability to exercise discretion in relation to the conduct of pool supervision, using the advice of the other staff where necessary.
  • Be able to communicate well with people from diverse backgrounds and ages in order to promote and maintain good customer and staff relations
  • Ability to supervise a large aquatic space while pro-actively ensuring a safe environment
  • Strong communication skills

In addition, the minimum qualification requirements for this position are:
  • Pool Lifeguard
  • Level 2 First Aid and CPR
  • Defibrillation certificate
  • Current Drivers Licence
  • Police Check
  • Working with Children Check.

As an employee of the City of Kingston you will have access to ongoing professional development and a range of employee benefits designed to promote a positive work/life balance, including social club events, wellbeing initiatives, discounted gym membership and health insurance.

886022399:
[

Deputy Principal (Two Roles)

Company Name Keysborough College Company Location Keysborough, AU

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

Description

ABOUT US

The mission of Lighthouse Christian College is ‘to assist Christian parents to teach and train their children in a Christian teaching and learning environment, so they will fulfil God’s plan for their lives, and bring this positive influence on our society’. Founded in 1989, the College has earned a reputation of being ‘the Christian’ choice for excellence in education. It has also recently been recognised for having the highest rating for student relational proximity across schools in both Australia and the UK by Dr Rob Loe, founder and director of Relational Schools.

About The Roles

We are restructuring the Deputy Principal function within our College and creating two new positions, Deputy Principal - Operations and Deputy Principal – Academic. Invitations are sought for either or both roles.

The Deputy Principal – Operations will support the Principal in providing both strategic and day to day leadership of the operational aspects of the College. They will be a member of the Senior Executive Team and report to the Principal on the operational leadership of the College and also be delegated to exercise direct responsibility in the areas of organisation and management. Whilst the primary responsibilities of the position are articulated, it is expected that the incumbent will engage with the wider College community and participate fully in events and activities, playing an ambassadorial role as a senior representative of Lighthouse Christian College. A Position Description including KPIs and requirements can be found here.

Likewise, the Deputy Principal – Academic will support the Principal in providing both strategic and day to day leadership of Christ-centred Teaching and Learning/Curriculum in the College. They will also be a member of the Senior Executive Team and will report to the Principal on the academic leadership of the College. They will also be delegated to exercise direct responsibility in the specifically designated areas of teaching and learning. Whilst the primary responsibilities of the position are articulated, it is also expected that the incumbent will engage with the wider College community and participate fully in events and activities, also playing an ambassadorial role as a senior representative of Lighthouse Christian College. A Position Description including KPIs and requirements can be found here.

About You

We are looking for candidates who know the call of God on their lives and who are passionate about Christian education, that are authentic with a strong personal presence, poise and natural capacity to inspire students, staff and stakeholders with the confidence to engage with parents and who are articulate and engaging with a personal warmth that engenders mutual respect and builds commitment to the College.

These roles require someone who is intellectually and emotionally intelligent and guided by a strong ethical framework and who are morally courageous and judicious in decision-making. You must be driven to achieve the best student outcomes for the College and a collaborative team player balanced with the ability to be decisive and directional where situations demand.

To apply, email your current resume and cover letter addressing the position description criteria in word or PDF format, along with the Lighthouse Christian College Teacher application form (available through the following link) Lighthouse Website, to Andrew Cavanagh at click apply

Applications close: Friday 12 October, 2018

We are a Child Safe employer, with a zero tolerance for child abuse.

VIT registration is mandatory for all teaching staff.

The Fred Hollows Foundation is one of Australia’s most respected and trusted international development organisations whose vision is to end avoidable blindness and ensure the work of Fred Hollows lives on. The Foundation works in 26 countries across Africa, Asia, The Pacific and the Middle East as well as in Australia.


Working as part of our Business Services team, in Sydney, the IT Support Officer will provide practical and hands on IT support for all new and existing Sydney based staff. This will include supporting the on-boarding and off - boarding of staff, service desk support, in collaboration with our 3rd party helpdesk as well as real-time support and troubleshooting across our IT infrastructure including video conferencing (Bluejeans), phones and printers. Whilst this is a standalone role, you will not be doing all of this alone! The Foundation has an experienced global team of IT professionals on hand to train and support you.


To be successful in this role, we are looking for someone who loves helping people to solve their technical headaches and who is passionate about providing excellent customer service. Previous experience of providing IT support for PCs, Macs, smart devices, video-conferencing equipment, printers, phone systems and networks would be highly desirable. Service Coordinator, Office Manager and Retail Coordinator

Company Name Vision Australia Company Location Epping, AU

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Permanent Full Time Opportunity
  • Epping, Sydney Location
  • Flexible Working Arrangements
  • Generous Salary Packaging Benefits

Vision Australia is a leading national provider of blindness and low vision services in Australia. We work in partnership with Australians who are blind or have low vision to help them achieve the possibilities they choose in life.

We support more than 27,500 people of all ages and life stages, and circumstances. We do this through 28 Vision Australia centres in Victoria, New South Wales, the Australian Capital Territory, Queensland, South Australia and Western Australia; 30 clinics; and through outreach programs in the Northern Territory and Tasmania.

An exciting opportunity awaits a Service Coordinator, Office Manager and Retail Coordinator to join our team in Epping , Sydney.

Responsibilities

As a Service Coordinator, Office Manager and Retail Coordinator at Vision Australia you will:
  • Support the Service Engagement Consultant and the Support Coordinator in the establishment and development of relationships with key health networks, community agencies and services e.g. NDIS and MAC, HCPs.
  • Contacting clients to follow up on and offer Vision Australia services, make appointments, resolve routine enquiries.
  • Act as a welcome and triage point to Vison Australia and handle general customer inquiries, Face to Face, phone, email
  • Undertake initial Priority of Needs discussions and refer to Service Engagement team
  • Providing a supportive and positive initial point of engagement to the office, at all points of contact, by utilising a person-centred and strengths based approach to support their goals.
  • Oversee and provide the administration of processing and billing requirements of NDIS, Home Care Packages (HCP) and My Aged Care (MAC).


Requirements

To be successful in this role you will have:
  • Certificate qualification in a relevant field (Disability, Community Services or Administration) or an equivalent combination of relevant qualifications plus/or extensive experience.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including a strong understanding and application of person-centred and strengths based approaches to engage with people who are blind or living with low vision and their families.
  • Proactive with identifying, analysing and implementing operational change to increase efficiency and effectiveness that will optimise a sustainable business.
  • Excellence in a range of Microsoft applications and software programs including client management and finance systems.
  • Experience in managing business finances i.e. banking and reconciliation.


Our Benefits

Working as part of Vision Australia you will enjoy a values based organisation with benefits including:
  • Friendly values based working environments
  • Generous salary packaging options
  • Exciting career paths
  • Exceptional professional development opportunities
  • Flexible working arrangements

We’re always on the lookout for energetic, motivated people who share our values to be Person Centred, Accountable, Collaborative, Commercially Focused and Agile.

Do you want to become a part of a team that supports a future where our clients have the opportunity like never before to live the life they choose? Please select the 'Apply' button below to be taken to our online application process.

Applications should consist of a full resume and a cover letter. Candidates should address the essential job competencies as outlined the position description and should also consider and be able to demonstrate Vision Australia’s organisational values which are central to the organisation’s culture. Applications should be uploaded as a word file. Please note pdf documents are not accepted for accessibility reasons.

As part of Vision Australia’s commitment to being an inclusive employer and embedding a culture where staff, volunteers and clients can be themselves and feel safe, and to protecting the best interests and safety of children and vulnerable people, successful applicants will be subject to a number of pre-employment checks including criminal history and working with children.

For more information about working at Vision Australia go to www.visionaustralia.org/careers

We encourage applications from candidates who are blind or have low vision.

IT Solution Lead – Workplace and Facilities Systems

Company Name Reserve Bank of Australia Company Location Sydney

New Posted Date Posted 1 hour ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes a range of associated activities in financial markets and banking. It also issues Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system. The RBA’s IT Department is responsible for transforming and developing the core IT functions that support its policy, operational and corporate objectives.


Our IT Enterprise Systems team is seeking a consultative and dynamic solution lead for its workplace and facilities systems portfolio. This demanding role provides end-to-end technical oversight of the technology solutions and systems the RBA requires to support key functions such as the physical security, building management, and access management requirements of our people and buildings.


The position is at its core a driver of IT technical solutions for Workplace Department, coordinating IT inputs from architecture, infrastructure, networks, and security.\xa0 Working closely with Workplace Department, the role provides market intelligence to inform technology recommendations as well as technical and functional leadership. It leads the team in the technical design of new applications as well as owning support and maintenance of current applications.


In return, we offer you an opportunity where you can be part of a team with real opportunities to grow your career in an organisation that makes a significant difference to the Australian people.


The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer.\xa0 We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.


Desired Skills and Experience

The incumbent leads and coaches team members from a technical perspective, and works closely with Workplace and IT stakeholders in supporting project and operational requirements. He/she will complete conceptual and system architecture documents mapping the portfolio across a complex domain, and lead resolution of production issues. The successful candidate will have a high degree of accountability and visibility within IT and with executive leadership within Corporate Services Group.\xa0


As a result, we require strong stakeholder management skills as well as a solid technical background with design and development across multiple platforms. Key knowledge requirements include ITIL frameworks, system integration technologies, authentication and access control methodologies, and web services technologies such as SOAP and REST. Knowledge of relevant industry trends, technologies, standards and best practices are required, and the ability to articulate technology benefit in terms of business functions. Relevant qualifications, either degree (IT or related) or professional accreditations, would be highly valued.

Contact the job poster

Jessica Stamedes

Company Name Arcare Aged Care Company Location Melbourne, AU

Job description

ARCARE CHELTENHAM AND ARCARE SURREY HILLS

Environmental Staff Required (laundry And Cleaners)
  • Five-star aged care
  • Casual employment
  • Melbourn South East Region- Arcare Cheltenham and Arcare Surrey Hills
  • Reference number: #17240


About Arcare

With our first aged care residence constructed in 1997, Arcare is the largest private residential aged care provider in Australia. We currently have over 35 residences throughout Victoria, New South Wales and Queensland.

Beyond the luxurious surroundings of our residences, our residents are supported by our innovative relationships first approach to celebrating and supporting old age. This approach is driven by our Arcare values of Relationships, Uniqueness, Partnerships and Flexibility.

Arcare believes that care and support is shaped by the quality of the relationships and interactions between clients, families and employees. That’s why we are committed to supporting and valuing the wellbeing and contribution of all those involved in the caring relationship.

About The Opportunity

We are looking for people who are flexible in their thinking and courageous in their actions. People with compassion and empathy, who understand that attitudes are contagious (and who have one worth sharing). People who can be themselves while upholding a high standard of behaviour.

Arcare have regular, ongoing flexible shifts across their aged care residences for experienced laundry attendants and cleaners. As a part of the Arcare Relief Team (South East region) you will have the opportunity to work across our two Residences located in the South Eastern suburbs and provide leave backfill as required.
  • Arcare Cheltenham - 161A Centre Dandnenong Road, Cheltenham
  • Arcare Surrey Hills - 18 Florence Road, Surrey Hills

We are looking for the right people to join us and build personally meaningful relationships with our residents, their families and your colleagues, as well as uphold our five star standards in the exceptional laundry and cleaning you will be doing.

If you would like to find out more about how you can become a part of the Arcare Relief Team, visit our website – www.arcare.com.au/careers and follow the link to apply.

Applications close 7 October 2018

Due to the high volume of recruitment activity, only successful applicants will be contacted

Registry Officer, Supreme Court of Victoria

Company Name Court Services Victoria Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Supreme Court of Victoria is the highest court in the State and comprises the Court of Appeal and the Trial Division. The Court deals with major criminal and civil matters, and appeals against decisions of lower courts.

The Court recognises that its people are integral to its ability to meet and exceed community expectations and to achieve its goal of being an outstanding superior court. At the Court, we continually strive to create a high performing workplace that is characterised by creativity, innovation, flexibility and quality delivery.

Working As Part Of a Large Team Within The Principal Registry, The Sucessful Applicant Will Perform a Wide Range Of Administrative Tasks, Including

The role of a Registry Officers is challenging and varied.
  • Checking legal documents for compliance with Rules
  • Taking receipt of checked documents and completing financial transactions (via counter service or electronic filing facilities)
  • Providing technical guidance and support to Principal Registry users regarding policy, practice and procedure
  • Maintaining the Court's electronic case management system, filing of documents/correspondence, file maintenance and preparation
  • Assisting with processing and receipt of Court held subpoenaed materials
  • Preparing and authenticating Court orders
  • Maintaining and monitoring lists of cases and liaising with the chambers of judicial officers to ensure the smooth operation of the Court
  • Establishing and maintaining trusting working relationships with Registry Lawyers and Associates
  • Undertaking other necessary administrative functions in order to support the operations of the Court in an increasingly digitalised environment

To be sucessful in this role, you must be able to work effectively as part of a team and be flexible in your approach to your work.

As well as the completed questions, your application should include a cover letter and resume and demonstrate how you meet the key capabilities of the role as detailed in the position description. Applications that do not answer the requisite questions will not be considered.

The Court provides a comprehensive employee benefits program and the opportunity to participate in professional growth and development. We are an equal opportunity employer and foster diversity in the workplace.

How To Apply

To apply, please click the ‘Apply Now' button, ensuring you include the following documents in your application:
  • resume
  • a short covering letter
  • completed application form (see file attachment)

For further information on the position, please see the attached position description.

Applications close: Tuesday 2 October 2018

Other Information

Court Services Victoria (CSV) is the employer of staff at all Victorian courts and tribunals, the Judicial College of Victoria, and the Judicial Commission of Victoria. CSV offers a wide range of legal and non-legal career options as well as attractive employee benefits.

CSV is committed to building a diverse workforce and inclusive culture. We strongly encourage people of all abilities to apply, particularly people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage, and those who may experience diversity or disability related barriers in securing employment.
